title: Remove actor-not-available alert and add contact number field to Book Service

requirements.summary: Remove the 'actor not available' alert that appears when users attempt to use the Book Service option, ensuring the booking flow remains accessible without blocking error dialogs
acceptanceCriteria: No 'actor not available' alert or toast is shown when the user navigates to or interacts with the Book Service page.
The Book Service page loads and renders without any blocking error dialogs related to actor availability.
If the actor is not yet initialized, the form should gracefully wait or show a loading state instead of an alert.

file_operations.description: Remove any alert/toast logic that displays 'actor not available' or similar error messages when the actor is not yet initialized. Replace with a graceful loading state or disabled form state that waits for the actor to become available without showing an error dialog. Ensure the form remains accessible and does not block users with alerts.

requirements.summary: Add a 'Contact Number' input field to the Book Service form, allowing users to provide a phone number when submitting a service booking request
acceptanceCriteria: The Book Service form includes a clearly labeled 'Contact Number' input field.
The contact number field accepts numeric and standard phone number characters.
The contact number value is submitted along with the rest of the work order data.
The backend WorkOrder data type is updated to include an optional or required contactNumber field.
The contact number is stored and retrievable via the backend.
The contact number is visible in the admin Work Orders view for each booking.

file_operations.description: Add a 'Contact Number' input field to the service booking form. Include proper validation for phone number format (numeric and standard phone characters). Update the form state to capture the contact number value and pass it to the createWorkOrder mutation when submitting. Ensure the field is clearly labeled and follows the existing form field styling and layout patterns.

Update the Work Orders table or detail view to display the customerContactNumber field for each work order. Ensure the contact number is visible to admins when viewing work order details or in the orders list, maintaining consistency with the existing layout and data display patterns.

Update the createWorkOrder mutation hook to include the contactNumber parameter in the backend method call. Ensure the parameter is passed correctly to actor.createWorkOrder() matching the backend interface signature that already includes customerContactNumber.
